results.title: Thirsty land
results.creator_credit: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan and World Food Program
results.brief_description: Describes the search for water in the deserts of Jordan, and other UN assisted works - the training of the Bedouin in farming techniques, the reclamation of land, irrigation, improvement of communications and reafforestation.

results.title: Thermionic valve
results.brief_description: The thermionic valve makes possible the control of energy that is released when electricity is liberated from a metal. The thermionic valve is the radio valve - the forerunner to mini valves, thence the transistor.

results.title: There once lived a dog
results.creator_credit: E. Nazarov and Soviet Film Studios Moscow
results.brief_description: A delightful Ukrainian folk tale about a pet dog who becomes a nuisance and is dumped in the local woods. The dog, with the help of a wolf, plans a way to be reaccepted by his owners.

results.title: There's more to it than that
results.creator_credit: Craig Baynes and Craig Baynes productions
results.brief_description: The story of a tire, the many complex steps needed in its production, and the men and women who have contributed their efforts in its manufacture.

results.title: Theory of management development
results.brief_description: Dr. Charles Ferguson presents a lecture about the nature of a manager, discussing some of the assumptions upon which management development theory is based, and the importance of a manager’s self knowledge and awareness of the multiple roles he or she performs as a supervisor, a peer, and a subordinate.

results.title: The Yugoslav experiment
results.brief_description: This film uses newsreels and interviews to trace the history of Yugoslavia and shows the present day situation, (of 1977). Emphasis is placed on the Yugoslav economy, the agricultural and industrial systems, tourism and education.
results.description: This film uses newsreels and interviews to trace the history of Yugoslavia and shows the present day situation, (of 1977). Emphasis is placed on the Yugoslav economy, the agricultural and industrial systems, tourism and education.

results.title: The Young volunteers
results.creator_credit: Peter Whale and Overseas Film & Television Centre
results.brief_description: British Voluntary Service Overseas: shows orientation process for volunteers at a South London Teachers College. Includes scenes of volunteers in Mauritus, Lima (Peru), Korea, Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Tanzania.

results.title: The Wynns, winegrowers
results.brief_description: Traces the growth of the Wynn’s family wind business over 50 years. From small beginnings they now own large vineyards in various parts of Australia. Illustrates the organisation of the entire industry from growing the grapes to marketing bottled table wines, champagne and flagons.

results.title: The World of semi conductors
results.creator_credit: Michael Oitom and A E I
results.brief_description: Describes the electrical properties of semiconductor materials, the effects of adding various controlled impurities, and the way in which semiconductors can be used for rectification or as amplifiers. Examples of both applications are shown, ranging from the minute transistorised transmitter in a radio pill for medical research to the banks of semiconductor rectifiers on heavy duty electric railway locomotives. Sketches the manufacturing process involved and examines the possibility of using semiconductors for power generation, central heating and refrigeration.
